intro: Ligularia qiaojiaensis, commonly known as the Qiaojia ligularia, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests. It is valued for its ornamental qualities and has limited horticultural use outside its native habitat. Due to its restricted distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
